value.name: About STFC – UKRI - Research Councils UK
value.snippet: The Science and Technology Facilities Council (STFC) supports research in astronomy, physics and space science, and operates world-class research facilities for the UK. Who we are How we’re governed STFC Visions Planning, strategy and reviews Our locations Business opportunities Our publications Our relationships Work for us Contact us

value.name: Science and Technology Facilities Council - Wikipedia
value.snippet: The Science and Technology Facilities Council ( STFC) is a United Kingdom government agency that carries out research in science and engineering, and funds UK research in areas including particle physics, nuclear physics, space science and astronomy (both ground-based and space-based).

value.name: STFC | LinkedIn
value.snippet: STFC is one of seven publicly-funded research councils and is part of UK Research and Innovation (UKRI). It is an independent, non-departmental public body of the Department for Business, Energy...

value.name: Home - STFC Careers
value.snippet: At the Science and Technology Facilities Council (STFC), research driven by practical applications meets research driven by curiosity to create a world-leading hub of scientific and engineering excellence. When you join STFC, you become a key part of one of Europe’s largest research organisations.

value.name: Science and Technology Facilities Council - The University of Edinburgh
value.snippet: The Science and Technology Facilities Council (STFC) supports research in particle physics, astronomy, astrophysics, nuclear physics, and solar system science. Most studentships are awarded on the basis of Doctoral Training Partnerships made to Schools.

value.name: Welcome To STFC

The Science and Technology Facilities Council is one of Europe's largest multidisciplinary research organisations supporting scientists and engineers world-wide. value.name: Welcome to STFC
value.description: The Science and Technology Facilities Council is one of Europe's largest multidisciplinary research organisations supporting scientists and engineers world-wide. Through research fellowships and grants, it is responsible for funding research in UK universities, in the fields of astronomy, particle physics, nuclear physics and space science ...

value.name: Particle accelerators at Daresbury Laboratory and international projects
value.description: STFC Daresbury Laboratory is renowned for its world leading scientific research in fields such as accelerator science, bio-medicine, physics, chemistry, materials, engineering and computational science. This video showcases the contributions of UK engineers to large scale international projects. Daresbury Laboratory is home to the Hartree ...

value.name: The Discovery of the Atomic Nucleus (3 of 15)
value.description: Episode 3 of In Search of Giants: Dr Brian Cox takes us on a journey through the history of particle physics. In this episode we learn how Ernest Rutherford conducted a historical experiment that revealed that most of the mass of an atom is concentrated in a tiny nucleus made of protons and neutrons. This film is part of a series originally ...

value.name: The Discovery of the Electron (2 of 15)
value.description: Episode 2 of In Search of Giants: Dr Brian Cox takes us on a journey through the history of particle physics. In this episode we learn how J.J. Thomson discovered the fist subatomic particle - the electron. This film is part of a series originally broadcast on Teachers' TV (http://www.teachers.tv/video/23645). The series was made with the ...

value.name: The Unification of Electricity and Magnetism (8 of 15)
value.description: Episode 8 of In Search of Giants: Dr Brian Cox takes us on a journey through the history of particle physics. In this episode we learn how Michael Faraday and James Clerk Maxwell showed that electricity and magnetism are two facets of the same thing. This film is part of a series originally broadcast on Teachers' TV (http://www.teachers.tv ...

value.name: Atoms and the Periodic Table (1 of 15)
value.description: Episode 1 of In Search of Giants: Dr Brian Cox takes us on a journey through the history of particle physics. In this episode we learn that the Greeks knew about atoms and how Mendeleyev's periodic table was among the first clues that the atom had a deeper structure. This film is part of a series originally broadcast on Teachers' TV (http://www ...

value.name: The Existence of Quarks (4 of 15)
value.description: Episode 4 of In Search of Giants: Dr Brian Cox takes us on a journey through the history of particle physics. In this episode we learn how Murray Gell-Mann predicted the existence of quarks. This film is part of a series originally broadcast on Teachers' TV (http://www.teachers.tv/video/23645). value.name: The Nature of Forces (6 of 15)
value.description: Episode 6 of In Search of Giants: Dr Brian Cox takes us on a journey through the history of particle physics. In this episode we learn how forces are the instruments of change in the universe. This film is part of a series originally broadcast on Teachers' TV (http://www.teachers.tv/video/23645).
